sentences.sContent: I waved but they took no notice.
sentences.sCn: 我挥了挥手，可是他们没有注意到。

sentences.sContent: I hope you’ll take notice of what I’m going to tell you.
sentences.sCn: 我希望你留心听我下面要对你讲的话。

sentences.sContent: This problem may have escaped your notice so far (= you may not have noticed it ).
sentences.sCn: 可能你还没有注意到这个问题。

sentences.sContent: This never came to my notice (= I never knew about this ).
sentences.sCn: 我从来没有注意到这一点。

sentences.sContent: There are several important matters that I’d like to bring to your notice (= that I would like you to know about ).
sentences.sCn: 有几件重要的事我想提醒你注意。

phrases.pCn: 不预先通知地；没有事先通知

在短时间内；立刻，即刻；一通知到就
即刻；随时；一经通知就立即
刚约就要见（没有给对方充裕的时间）

words.tran: 著名的；显著的；附有乐谱的
显而易见的，显著的；值得注意的

注意；记下（note的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: when you notice or pay attention to someone or something
if someone can’t help noticing something, they realize that it exists or is happening even though they are not deliberately trying to pay attention to it
